column4: does anyone have any suggestions on how to flash a BIOS from Linux?
I'm trying to update my mobo bios so I can install my new AMD 6400 CPU, but everywhere I go there's either sites telling me "use a floppy", although my machine has none.  Any suggestions?
I think you can burn the files to a CD and use the floppy image as the bootable image for the CD. I don't have instructions to do so though.
hmm... using a floppy image to make a bootable CD?  interesting..
yes. k3b I know can burn that type of disc.
do I need the floppy info in order to burn it onto the disc or does k3b already have it in it's system ready?
hmm.. ok.  i'll see what I can find.  thanks!

wow, there's a lot of kde stuff I have to install just to get k3b installed, heh.  I'm running purely gnome right now, and I hate to install useless programs for just one.  you know of any other programs that will definitely write a floppy image?
I don't know if gnomebaker will. I'm curious, so I'll find out.
i'm trying that too right now also.
I found that Nero has a Linux install.  I want to try that one too.  I'll let you know.
it seems that Nero Linux 3 has a DOS boot image with the install.  Going to try that out and reboot.  I'll let you know when I come back
thanks. I may have to check it out.
if this works, It may just well be worth the $20.00 for the full version... to me.
